title: Butterick logo
content:
Hope someone can help me ID this old logotype, or rather the face its made from. Cheers!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014553im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Butterick_3498.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Lively casual Latin display type - MVB Hotsy Totsy {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014553/http:/www.typophile.com/node/29542 "Go to previous forum topic") [childish font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014553/http:/www.typophile.com/node/29533 "Go to next forum topic")
author: outputdan

comments.content: Looks like a modified Caslon with swashes, and Helvetica light underneath.

Also thought it might be a version of caslon, perhaps an old typositor version or maybe one from the Photo-lettering collection. Also saw an old headline font called Grumpy that looked close, not sure if it’s been digitized though. Sorry couldn’t be more help.

Rob
If you need a Caslon with swashes, check [Cabernet](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014553/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=JBT0001003).
